7ac0672b-2afa-4976-af07-4fe2eefc5b8e.description: Students who receive this badge have completed requirements provided by Missouri Department of Health and Senior Services (DHSS) and have been tested and certified to work in healthcare in the state of Missouri.
7ac0672b-2afa-4976-af07-4fe2eefc5b8e.name: Certified Nursing Assistant

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Missouri

badge_template_activities.title: Minimum of 3 comprehensive exams with a minimum score of 80%
75 hours of classroom instruction and 100 hours of clinical time.
Final State Exam, both written and skills demonstration.

ed159608-0d74-4dee-b18c-809527d9917b.description: The Strategic Partner Leadership Professional®️ (SPLP®️) Exam is a 75 question multiple-choice assessment. The SPLP certifies a learner's accumulated knowledge of the PARTNERNOMICS®️ methodology which includes the Partnering Foundations, Strategic Partner Leadership Model, and 5 Phase Partnering Process courses.
ed159608-0d74-4dee-b18c-809527d9917b.name: PARTNERNOMICS® Strategic Partner Leadership Professional®️ (SPLP®️)

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Missouri

badge_template_activities.title: Partnering Foundations course is the first course in the recommended three-course sequence. This course is designed for business professionals who are interested in understanding the foundational components of developing long-term strategic partnerships with complementary organizations. This course explores the essential terms, concepts, processes, and strategies that leaders can utilize to generate profit growth through successful partnerships.

SPLM course is designed for business professionals who are interested in learning how to operationalize partnerships to ensure success. This course introduces our proprietary Strategic Partner Leadership Model (SPLM) framework, which teaches a systematic way for your organization to effectively manage and lead strategic relationships.

5-Phase Partnering Process course is designed for the business professional who is interested in taking a deep dive into the “pre-contract signature” processes to understand the optimal way to construct partnership agreements, perform due diligence, and negotiate agreements. This course teaches five phases with an emphasis on :  Building a Strategic Partnering Plan Engaging Partner Candidates Bargaining/Negotiating the Agreement Closing the Agreement Operationalizing the Partnership

b2b3531c-f1e2-4267-873c-9285f4d7ba93.description: The Phlebotomy Technician Certificate Program prepares students to enter the healthcare field and to pursue certification for the National Healthcare Association’s industry exam. Students will learn the process and procedures for collecting blood specimens for analysis, all aspects of blood collection, the order of draw, universal precautions, skills to perform venipunctures completely and safely as well as the related terminology, anatomy and physiology.
b2b3531c-f1e2-4267-873c-9285f4d7ba93.name: Phlebotomy Technician

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Missouri

badge_template_activities.title: 160 Classroom Hours40 Externship Hours

6047add5-d52e-41a8-8750-c4b65bf4d822.description: The Harmon Professional Edge program was created to help students fill the gap between college and career. In this program, students will gain skills through hands-on experiences that will set them up for success in the professional world. By combining curricular and co-curricular engaged learning experiences, students will graduate better prepared for the workforce and have a competitive edge against the competition.
6047add5-d52e-41a8-8750-c4b65bf4d822.name: The Harmon Professional Edge

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Missouri

badge_template_activities.title: Edge Readiness - Students must take a career development course that prepares them for entering the workforce. In most cases, this will be Career Readiness or Business Communication. Within this course, students will build a resume and digital profile, attend a career expo, write a cover letter, build a reference page, and participate in mock interviews. Students must earn a C or better.

Edge Diversity - Students must take a class or classes that value, respect, and emphasize learning about diverse cultures, races, ages, genders, sexual orientations, and religions. Classes will allow students to demonstrate openness, inclusivity, sensitivity, and the ability to interact respectfully with all people and understand individuals’ differences. Students must earn a C or better to qualify.

Edge Internship/Practicum - The purpose of completing an internship or practicum is to apply the knowledge, skills, and theory gained up to this point via an out-of-the-classroom, practical, and applied experience. Ideally, soft skills and emotional intelligence will be tested and enhanced. Extensive work experience directly related to the major, documented and approved by the Harmon College Internship Office, may be accepted for completion of this component. Students must earn a C or better.

Edge Practice - Students will provide proof of participation in three (or more) activities that help boost their career readiness, apply soft skills and knowledge, engage with professionals, or expand their network. There is a broad spectrum of activities that can occur on and off-campus.

04c866e8-3d22-481b-b3a2-39557c898aef.description: The Partnering Foundations Certification Exam is a 30 question multiple-choice assessment, learners must first complete the Partnering Foundations course and score a 75% or higher to earn their certification. The Foundations Certification certifies a learner's accumulated knowledge of the PARTNERNOMICS® Partnering Foundations course.
04c866e8-3d22-481b-b3a2-39557c898aef.name: PARTNERNOMICS® Partnering Foundations Certified

This course is designed for business professionals who are interested in understanding the foundational components of developing long-term strategic partnerships with complementary organizations. This course explores the essential terms, concepts, processes, and strategies that leaders can utilize to generate profit growth through successful partnerships.

eb282a9d-08f5-4f57-88e0-0376f15bae6e.description: The Strategic Partner Leadership Model Certification is a 30 question multiple-choice assessment, learners must first complete the Strategic Partner Leadership Model course and score a 75% or higher to earn their certification. The SPLM Certification certifies a learner's accumulated knowledge of the PARTNERNOMICS® Strategic Partner Leadership Model course.

This course introduces our proprietary Strategic Partner Leadership Model (SPLM) framework, which teaches a systematic way for your organization to effectively manage and lead strategic relationships.

4f3a0ad4-f3bc-4428-8e13-c1ba03b0c376.description: This medical billing and coding with remote certification course offers the skills needed to solve insurance billing problems, how to manually file claims (using the CPT and ICD-10 manual), complete common insurance forms, trace delinquent claims, appeal denied claims and use generic forms to streamline billing procedures. Students also complete a HIPPA Certification and a Remote worker certification.
4f3a0ad4-f3bc-4428-8e13-c1ba03b0c376.name: Medical Billing and Coding

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Missouri

badge_template_activities.title: 300 Contact Hours

3d494e91-c6e6-4124-bebe-03dda54e2cd3.description: Earners of this Project Management badge gained knowledge and skills needed to begin and continue a career in project management. Additionally, the student developed knowledge and skills needed to prepare for the PMI® Project Management Professional (PMP) or Certified Associate in Project Management (CAPM) certification* exams.
3d494e91-c6e6-4124-bebe-03dda54e2cd3.name: Project Management

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Missouri

alignments.name: PMBOK® Guide – Sixth Edition
alignments.description: The CAPM and PMP certification aligns to A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK Guide), which is the preeminent global standard recommended by PMI for project management and provides the fundamental practices of the profession.

alignments.name: Rita Mulcahy’s study guide 9th edition
alignments.description: Features of this worldwide best-selling resource include the following: Practice exam questions—more than 400 throughout the book. A focus on what you really need to know to pass the exam. Exclusive exercises and Tricks of the Trade®. A straightforward approach to complex material.

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in 160 hours of instruction and out of class work
Work in a holistic learning environment to increase ability to apply the related knowledge, skills, and abilities required to successfully perform at a high level in life and on-the-job
Demonstrate Academic and Workplace Competencies (Tiers 1-3) of the DOL-ETA Competency Model Pyramid

8514bcec-8ca6-4804-8325-1d4c6278937d.description: The Master Academic Success Coach (MASC) badge was created to recognize achieved competency and professionalization for Academic Success Coaches. MASC’s partner with an advisor to provide outreach and assistance to undergraduate students. MASC’s work 1:1 with students to identify barriers, assistance in overcoming barriers, and provide holistic support for academic success. MASCs may also serve as a teaching assistant for UNIV courses, and assist with leading student workshops/presentations.
8514bcec-8ca6-4804-8325-1d4c6278937d.name: Master Academic Success Coach

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Missouri

badge_template_activities.title: Students must complete the Certified Peer Educator (CPE) Training through NASPA, and pass the certification exam. CPE Training is a 12-hour course that facilitates the development of leadership skills by covering the role of a peer educator, helping peers make positive behavioral changes, as well as the development of skills such as, listening, response and referral, intervention, recognizing the role of diversity and inclusivity, programming, presentation, self-care, and group dynamics.
Students must have worked as an Academic Success Coach for at least two full semesters before they are eligible to earn this badge.
Students must have received a positive performance evaluation with the ratings of meets or exceeds expectations in all areas, and the overall rating.
Students meeting all of the above criteria, must be subsequently nominated by their supervising Academic Success Advisor.

6c359d69-4081-4f78-b2f4-506fddb59b06.description: The Channel Partnerships Certification Exam is a 30-question multiple-choice assessment, learners must first complete the Channel Partnerships course and score a 75% or higher to earn their certification. The Channel Partnerships Certification certifies a learner's accumulated knowledge of the PARTNERNOMICS® Channel Partnerships course.
6c359d69-4081-4f78-b2f4-506fddb59b06.name: PARTNERNOMICS® Channel Partnerships Certified

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Missouri

badge_template_activities.title: The Channel Partnerships course leverages 14 years of research and insights from more than 300 partnership executives, 30 best-selling authors, and ivy-league professors. Learners step through the 6 phases of the channel partnering process and are guided through a disciplined process to create their company-specific channel partnering playbook.

16421240-dd15-4b35-aa57-871d59880aa3.description: The Master Academic Success Advisor (MASA) badge was created to recognize an achieved mastery of the key essential advising competencies (NACADA), and professionalization for Academic Success Advisors. The Academic Success Advisor is responsible for the delivery of personalized, proactive assistance that facilitates, supports and empowers student success, from new student onboarding to graduation, and life beyond.
16421240-dd15-4b35-aa57-871d59880aa3.name: Master Academic Success Advisor

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Missouri

badge_template_activities.title: Minimum 2 years student services experience; minimum of 1 year at UCM in primary advising role.
Credentialed in the administration and interpretation of learning diagnostics and career assessments.
Must be nominated by their supervisor, having demonstrated creativity, initiative, and actively participate/collaborate within the Success Advising team environment.
They must demonstrate engagement in appropriate and ethical decision-making and exhibit an advanced cultural awareness and understanding.
Must be fluent in academic advising technologies such as, Achieve E2E, MyCentral, MySchedule, Banner, Degree Works, TES/Tranfer Articulation, Blackboard Learning Management System, SLATE, etc.
Individual Academic Success Advisor's advising philosophy, along with a resume or vita.
Professional Advisor Competency Assessment

a39ab4f2-6a78-4a08-87a2-fa40bb9817a3.description: The Certified Medication Technician Development Program ensures that students develop the knowledge needed to advance their skills as Certified Nursing Assistants and qualify them for employment as Certified Medication Technicians and Insulin Administrators in intermediate care or skilled nursing facilities. 104 classroom hours.
a39ab4f2-6a78-4a08-87a2-fa40bb9817a3.name: Certified Medication Technician

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Missouri

badge_template_activities.title: The University of Central Missouri Certified Medication Technician Development certificate program will prepare students to advance in their career and increase their value to employers. The course will include classroom work as well as clinical and exam components. Successful students will advance their CNA skills, qualifying them to work as certified medication technicians and insulin administrators in intermediate care or skilled nursing facilities.

f303f7c5-995b-4ac5-84bf-c1a9aa286201.description: The Solution Partnerships Certification Exam is a 30-question multiple-choice assessment, learners must first complete the 5-Phase Partnering Process course and score a 75% or higher to earn their certification. The Solution Partnerships Certification certifies a learner's accumulated knowledge of the PARTNERNOMICS® 5-Phase Partnering Process course.
f303f7c5-995b-4ac5-84bf-c1a9aa286201.name: PARTNERNOMICS® Solution Partnerships Certified

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Missouri

badge_template_activities.title: The 5-Phase Partnering Process course is designed for those interested in taking a deep dive into the “pre-contract signature” processes to understand the optimal way to construct partnership agreements, perform due diligence, and negotiate agreements that deliver results. This course teaches the following five phases: 1. Building a Strategic Partnering Plan 2. Engaging Partner Candidates 3. Bargaining/Negotiating the Agreement 4. Closing the Agreement 5. Operationalizing the Partnership

6d0eb27e-c569-4ad1-b021-e35f2846df1a.description: The Senior Academic Success Coach (SASC) badge was created to recognize the highest level of competency and professionalization for Academic Success Coaches. SASC’s serve to mentor other success coaches, lead student staff trainings, and serve on office committees. SASC’s also serve as the primary providers of student workshops and presentations on academic success topics. Additionally, SASC’s may be tasked with additional responsibilities within the scope of Success Advising Center operations.
6d0eb27e-c569-4ad1-b021-e35f2846df1a.name: Senior Academic Success Coach

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Missouri

badge_template_activities.title: Master Academic Success Coach

Student’s are eligible to apply after earning the Master Academic Success Coach (MASC) rating, and serving in this capacity for a minimum of one semester. The MASC required them to become certified peer educators (NASPA-CPE), and serve as an Academic Success Coach for a minimum of two semesters, or four semesters of experience in a related student support position.

Students must complete the Advanced Peer Educator (APEX) course. This focuses on further development of success coach competencies. APEX students learn how to articulate the value of peer education, provide tailored support to students, and promote diversity, inclusion, and social justice. Students gain a deeper understanding of student development theory, the transitional process of first-time college students, and being mindful of identities and intersectionality when working with students.

Student’s interested in becoming a Senior Academic Success Coach (SASC) must complete an application after meeting the minimum eligibility requirements. To apply, the student must submit a personal statement with regards to the SASC position, and a recommendation letter from their supervising advisor. The selection process includes an administrative review by the Academic Success Coach Committee of their personal statement, performance evaluation(s), and supervising advisor recommendation.

Recommendation for promotion to SASC is forwarded by the Academic Success Coach Committee to the Success Advising Leadership Team (SALT) for review. After discussion, the SALT will vote on the promotion recommendation; promotion will be confirmed by majority vote.

5afc0d90-c657-47b2-a05e-48cdb55efa4d.description: The Senior Academic Success Advisor badge is awarded to advisors who have achieved the highest level of professional competency (NACADA). In addition to their primary advisor role, they serve as lead mentors for other advisors, and are actively engaged in activities related to the growth and development of advising through research, the innovative leveraging of technology and best practices, and presentation of same. They are recognized leaders in professional organizations and committees.
5afc0d90-c657-47b2-a05e-48cdb55efa4d.name: Senior Academic Success Advisor

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Missouri

badge_template_activities.title: Minimum 5 years student services experience, with a minimum of 3 years experience in primary advising role.
Master Academic Success Advisor

Must be nominated by their supervisor, having promoted the profession through leadership roles on committees (UCM or SAC), in professional organizations (MACADA, NACADA), through professional conference presentation, and/or through NACADA publishing.

Serve as a lead Academic Success Advisor, providing mentorship to other Success Advisors, and taking advantage of opportunities to serve in additional roles that demand greater management and/or administrative responsibility as needed.
